troubleshooting_scenarios.description: Users are unable to stream content or experience buffering.
steps: Check if the internet connection is stable and meets the minimum bandwidth requirement.
Restart the streaming device (smart TV, phone, laptop, etc.).
Clear the app or browser cache.
Verify that the streaming service is updated to the latest version.
Ensure the user’s subscription plan supports the requested content.
Check the streaming platform's server status (provide a link if applicable).

troubleshooting_scenarios.description: Content doesn’t play, or users encounter error messages during playback.
steps: Confirm that the content being accessed is included in the subscription package.
Ensure that digital rights management (DRM) is enabled on the device.
Restart the application or browser and try again.
Check for any ongoing outages in the service (server-side).
Provide error code-specific solutions (e.g., 'Error 403: Unauthorized access').

troubleshooting_scenarios.description: The video resolution drops unexpectedly (e.g., from HD to SD).
steps: Check the user’s internet speed (recommend a minimum of 5 Mbps for HD streaming).
Ensure no other devices are consuming excessive bandwidth.
Enable auto-quality adjustment in the app settings.
Restart the streaming device and app.
Update the application or firmware of the device.

troubleshooting_scenarios.description: Users cannot log in to the Synamedia platform or access their accounts.
steps: Verify that the username and password are correct.
Check if the account is active (ensure subscription validity).
Reset the password using the 'Forgot Password' option.
Clear cookies and cache in the browser or app.
Ensure that the browser or app is compatible with the platform.

troubleshooting_scenarios.description: DRM-protected content fails to play or shows restricted access errors.
steps: Confirm that the device supports DRM (e.g., Widevine, PlayReady).
Check if the required browser extension for DRM is installed and enabled.
Update the browser or app to the latest version.
Verify that the user has the appropriate permissions to access the content.
Contact technical support if the problem persists.

troubleshooting_scenarios.description: Business insights or targeted advertising metrics are not displayed in the analytics dashboard.
steps: Check the user’s internet connection and reload the dashboard.
Ensure that the user’s subscription plan includes analytics features.
Clear the browser or app cache and cookies.
Verify that the dashboard API is active (check the status page if applicable).
Try accessing the dashboard on a different browser or device.

troubleshooting_scenarios.description: Users receive anti-piracy alerts or face access restrictions.
steps: Verify that the content is being accessed from an authorized device and location.
Ensure that the user’s account credentials have not been compromised.
Check if multi-factor authentication (MFA) is enabled for the account.
Update the user’s device security settings (firewall, antivirus).
Contact the security team if unauthorized access is suspected.
